quiz.text: Find the difference between time taken by pipes P and Q together to fill the tank to that taken by pipes R and S together to fill the tank.
options: 11.25 minutes
12.5 minutes
15.75 minutes
10.5 minutes
16.25 minutes

quiz.text: Find the ratio of time taken by pipes R and A together to fill the tank to that taken by pipes S and A together to fill the tank.
options: 21: 101
105: 854
14: 113
35: 211
7: 57

quiz.text: If efficiency of pipe T were 90% of its original efficiency and efficiency of pipe A were 83(1/3) % of its original efficiency, then in what time both the pipes together would fill the tank?
options: 1200 minutes
1600 minutes
1000 minutes
1500 minutes
1800 minutes

quiz.text: If the quantity of water filled by pipes Q and A together in 1 minute is 32 L, then find the capacity of the tank.
options: 3600 Litres
2700 Litres
1800 Litres
4500 Litres
2500 Litres

quiz.text: Find the average time taken by each inlet pipe alone to fill the tank.
options: 157 minutes
141 minutes
179 minutes
165 minutes
123 minutes

quiz.text: There are 3 inlet pipes A, B and C and 2 outlet pipes P and Q which are used to fill a tank. Pipes A and B together can fill the tank in 20 min, pipe C alone can fill the tank in ____ min. Pipes A, B and Q together can fill that tank completely in 24 min. Pipe P alone can empty the tank in _____ min and time taken by all the five taps together to fill the tank is 20 min. Which of the following value will fill the blanks given in the question in the same order? A: 45 and 60 B: 30 and 48 C: 20 and 24
options: Only A and B
Only C
All A, B and C
None
Only B and C

quiz.text: Two houses A and B have two water tanks T1 and T2 respectively of different capacity. There are three pipes X, Y and Z. X and Z can fill the tank T2 in 56 minutes and 112 minutes respectively and pipe Y is an Emptying Pipe can empty the tank T2 in 84 minutes. If all three pipes are for opened tank T1 for (P – 48) minutes so they can fill _____ litres which is one fourth of total capacity of tank T1. If they all opened alternately in X, Z and Y order for tank T1 for (P + _____) minutes they can fill _____ portion of tank T1. Total capacity of tank T2 is 336 litres Which are of the following statement (s) is/are satisfy the blanks in same order? I). 180, 17, 29/120 II). 90, 30, 5/9 III). 112.5, 37, 91/225
options: I only
I and III only
II and III only
I and II only
I, II and III

quiz.text: There are two inlet pipes P1 and P2 and a drainage pipe P3. Time taken by P2 to fill the tank alone is T hours and that of P1 is (T – 4), and time taken by P3 is 32 hours. When P1 and P2 opened simultaneously, they fill the tank in 120/11 hours. When P3 is fitted at 1/3rd of height from bottom of tank and P1 is fitted at top of tank, both opened simultaneously, then find the approximate time taken by P1and P3 together to fill 50% of the tank?
options: 16.5 hours
15.5 hours
17.5 hours
15.2 hours
16.2 hours

quiz.text: Pipe B takes 4 minutes less than pipe A to fill a tank and pipe C takes 3 minutes more than pipe A to fill the tank. Time taken by pipe B alone to fill 3/4 part of tank is equal to that taken by pipe C alone to fill 2/5 part of tank. If pipes A and C are opened together for first 5 minutes and then pipe B alone fill the remaining tank, then the part of tank filled by pipe B alone is ________.
options: 1/4
2/5
1/2
2/3
1/3

quiz.text: There are three pipes A, B and C and all are inlet pipes. Pipe B can fill a tank in 18 minutes and the ratio of efficiency of pipe A and pipe C is 4 : 3. Pipes A and C together will fill 6 liters/minute more water in the tank than pipes B and C together. Time taken by Pipe B and Pipe C together can fill a tank in 11 (13/25) minutes. Then the time taken by pipes A and B together can fill the tank in _______ minutes.
options: 10 2/7 minutes
5 1/7 minutes
9 6/7 minutes
4 4/5 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: In a tank two inlet pipes A and B and two outlet pipes C and D are connected. Efficiencies of pipes B and D are 62.5% and 33(1/3) % of that of pipe A. Find the time taken by pipes C and D together to empty the fully filled tank? I: Pipes B and C together can fill the tank in 1 hour. II: Efficiency of pipe C is 33(1/3) % of that of pipe B, and pipe C alone can empty 50% tank in 60 minutes.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question but the statement II alone is not sufficient.
Statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question but the statement I alone is not sufficient.
Both statements I and II together are needed to answer the question.
Either statement I alone or statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
Both the statements together are not sufficient to answer the question

quiz.text: Find the tank taken by Pipe P1 to fill the tank alone. Statement I. Time taken by pipe P1 alone to fill the tank is 14 hours less than that of pipe P2. Statement II. Pipe P3 can fill the tank alone in 56 hours, and the rate of filling of pipe P3 is 33.33% more than that of P2.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient to answer the questions
Statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
Either statement I or II is sufficient to answer the question.
Both statements I and II are required to answer the question.
Both statements together are not sufficient to answer the question

quiz.text: Pipe A can fill a tank in 30 hours while pipe C takes 4 hours more than pipe B to fill the same tank. Pipe D can empty the tank in y hours. In how much time B and D together can fill the tank?  Statement I: Pipes A, B and D can fill the tank together in 15 hours. Statement II: Pipes C and D together can fill the tank in 40 hours.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If data either in statement I alone or statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question
If data in both statements I & II together are necessary to answer the question
If data given in both I & II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Pipes B and C are used to fill the tank and A is an outlet pipe in the bottom of the tank. The efficiencies of A, B and C are in the ratio 2 : 1 : 4 respectively. How much time will C alone take to fill the empty tank? Statement I: B alone takes 9 hours more than C to fill the tank. Statement II: B and C together can fill the tank in 2.40 hours.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If data either in statement I alone or statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question
If data in both statements I & II together are necessary to answer the question
If data given in both I & II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Three pipes A, B and C are used to fill a tank. What is the difference between the time taken by A and B together to fill the tank and the time taken by A and C together to fill the tank? Statement I: All three pipes together can fill the tank in 40 minutes. Statement II: The efficiencies of pipes A, B, and C respectively are in Arithmetic progression in increasing order.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If data either in statement I alone or statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question
If data in both statements I & II together are necessary to answer the question
If data given in both I & II together are not sufficient to answer the question

quiz.text: In each of the following questions, two quantities P and Q is given to you. Find the correct relation between P and Q. Pipe X can fill the tank in 40 hours where pipe Y and Z can fill the tank together in 100 hours .pipe X, Y are inlet pipes and pipe Z is an outlet pipe. P = Find the time taken by pipe Y alone to fill 40% of the tank alone if pipe X and Z together fill 45% of tank in 30 hours Q = Find the time taken by pipe A (inlet) alone to fill one – third of the tank if pipe Y, Z and A together can fill the tank in 37.5 hours
options: P > Q
P = Q
P < Q
P ≥ Q
P ≤ Q

quiz.text: Quantity I: Pipe P and pipe Q can fill the tank alone in 12 hours and 16 hours respectively, while pipe R can empty the tank alone in 30 hours. If pipe P and pipe Q opened simultaneously, and after 6 hours they are closed. Now find the time taken by pipe R to empty the tank, such that the tank is half-filled with its capacity. Quantity II: 11 hours 25 minutes
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II

quiz.text: Quantity I: P, Q and R are three pipes capable of filling an empty tank in 70, 105 and 60 hours respectively. When the tank was empty pipe R was opened for 2 hours, then R and Q were together opened for 6 hours. In how much time the remaining tank is filled by pipe P and Q together? Quantity II: The ratio of the capacity of tank A, B and C is 6 : 8 : 5, ratio of the efficiency of their inlet pipes is 3 : 4 : 2 and ratio of the efficiency of their outlet pipes is 1 : 3 : 1. If all the inlet and outlet pipes are open, net water input in A and B is same and tank A gets filled in 18 hours. What is the average time taken (in hours) for filling of B and C? What is the value of ‘Quantity I + Quantity II’?
options: 64
58.5
73
48.25
56.5

quiz.text: Quantity I: Pipes A and B can fill a tank in 5 and 6 hours respectively while C can empty it in 15 hours. In empty tank, pipe A and C are opened together for 3 hours and rest of the tank is filled by B and C together. In how much time the tank becomes full? Quantity II:  12 hours
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity I: Pipe A can fill a tank in 80 minutes and Pipe B can fill the same tank in 120 minutes. In how many minutes both the pipes can fill the tank? Quantity II: A pipe can fill a tank with water in 12 minutes. Due to leakage in the bottom, it takes 15 minutes to fill it. In how many minutes will the leak empty the filled tank? Quantity III: 50
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II = Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: Pipe A and B fill the tank and pipe C empty the tank. Pipe A alone fill the tank in 45 hours and efficiency of pipe B is 25% less than pipe A and pipe C can empty the tank in 75 hours. If all the three pipes were opened simultaneously, then after how much time pipe C is closed in order to the tank fill completely in 36 hours?
options: 20 hours
30 hours
40 hours
25 hours
45 hours

quiz.text: There are three pipes P, Q, and R. P and Q can fill the tank alone in 8 hours and 6 hours respectively, while Q can empty the tank in 12 hours. Condition 1: P and Q opened simultaneously, when tank is 70% filled then R is opened. Total time taken to fill the tank is T1 hours Condition 2: P and Q opened simultaneously, when tank is 35% filled then R is opened. Total time taken to fill the tank is T2 hours. Find the difference between T1 and T2?
options: 0.80 hours
0.64 hours
0.60 hours
0.48 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C are three pipes in a tank and each can be used as inlet or outlet pipe. Pipe B is 80% as efficient as pipe C. When all are used as inlet pipes they can fill the tank in 60 hours. If A and B are inlet and C is outlet, the empty tank can be filled in x hours while if A is inlet and B and C are outlet, full tank can be emptied in y hours, such that x is 60% of y. If A and C are inlet and B is outlet, in how much time (in hours) 70% of the tank can be filed?
options: 72
75
105
120
90

quiz.text: Three Pipes A, B, and C can fill a tank in 24 hours, 30 hours and 60 hours respectively. If Pipe A is opened all the time, Pipe B and Pipe C are opened for alternate hours starting with Pipe B, how much time will this process take to fill the tank? (Approx.)
options: 12.25 hours
6.32 hours
7.75 hours
14.89 hours
9.99 hours

quiz.text: Pipes A and C can fill a tank in 60 hours and 36 hours respectively while pipe B can empty it in 90 hours. In empty tank, A and C are opened for 12 hours then B and C are opened for 5 hours. If 276 liters of the tank is empty, what is the total capacity (in liters) of the tank?
options: 960
840
480
720
680
